tool.name: Pisces GeminiMulti
tool.description: pair-aware indel realigner and read stitcher
tool.command:
## skipped --samtoolsoldstyle, --help/-h, --version/-v
## preprocessing @GENOMESIZE@ mkdir data && ln -s '${bam}' 'data/sample.bam' && ln -s '${bam.metadata.bam_index}' 'data/sample.bam.bai' &&
## run /home/stephan/Projects/tools/pisces/All_5.3.0.0/GeminiMulti ## TODO ## required --bam 'data/sample.bam' --genome 'genome' --samtools 'samtools' --numprocesses \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} --exepath '/home/stephan/Projects/tools/pisces/All_5.3.0.0/Gemini' ## TODO --outfolder 'results' ## common $co.keepbothsidesoftclips $co.trustsoftclips $co.keepprobe $co.remaskmessysoftclips $mode_cond.mode_sel ## --stitchonly | --realignonly #if $mode_cond.mode_sel == '' or $mode_cond.mode_sel == '--stitchonly true' ## stitching --minbasecallquality $mode_cond.so.minbasecallquality $mode_cond.so.nifydisagreement --maxreadlength $mode_cond.so.maxreadlength $mode_cond.so.dontstitchrepeatoverlap $mode_cond.so.ignorereadsabovemaxlength $mode_cond.so.countnstowarddisagreeingbases --maxnumdisagreeingstitchedbases $mode_cond.so.maxnumdisagreeingstitchedbases #if $mode_cond.so.stringtagstokeepfromr1 != '' --stringtagstokeepfromr1 '$mode_cond.so.stringtagstokeepfromr1' #end if #end if #if $mode_cond.mode_sel == '' or $mode_cond.mode_sel == '--realignonly true' ## realignment $mode_cond.ro.maskpartialinsertion --minimumunanchoredinsertionlength $mode_cond.ro.minimumunanchoredinsertionlength $mode_cond.ro.softclipunknownindels $mode_cond.ro.checksoftclipsformismatches $mode_cond.ro.trackmismatches #if $mode_cond.ro.categoriestorealign != '' --categoriestorealign '$mode_cond.ro.categoriestorealign' #end if #if $mode_cond.ro.categoriestosnowball != '' --categoriestosnowball '$mode_cond.ro.categoriestosnowball' #end if $mode_cond.ro.pairawareeverything $mode_cond.ro.forcehighlikelihoodrealigners ## realignment bins --messysitethreshold $mode_cond.rbo.messysitethreshold --messysitewidth $mode_cond.rbo.messysitewidth $mode_cond.rbo.collectdepth --imperfectfreqthreshold $mode_cond.rbo.imperfectfreqthreshold --indelregionfreqthreshold $mode_cond.rbo.indelregionfreqthreshold --regiondepththreshold $mode_cond.rbo.regiondepththreshold $mode_cond.rbo.recalculateusablesitesaftersnowball #end if ## gemini multi --multiprocess true #if $gmo.chromosomes != '' --chromosomes '$gmo.chromosomes' #end if ## read filtering $rfo.skipandremovedups --minmapquality $rfo.minmapquality $rfo.filterforproperpairs $rfo.treatabnormalorientationasimproper ## indel --minpreferredsupport $ifo.minpreferredsupport --minpreferredanchor $ifo.minpreferredanchor --minrequiredindelsupport $ifo.minrequiredindelsupport --minrequiredanchor $ifo.minrequiredanchor --maxmessthreshold $ifo.maxmessthreshold --binsize $ifo.binsize $ifo.requirepositiveoutcomeforsnowball ## processing --readcachesize 1000 --regionsize 10000000 --numconcurrentregions 1 --maxnumthreads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} ## read silencing --directionalmessthreshold $rso.directionalmessthreshold --messymapq $rso.messymapq $rso.silencesuspiciousmdreads $rso.silencedirectionalmessreads $rso.silencemessymapmessreads ## debug --logregionsandrealignments false --lightdebug false --debug false --keepunmerged false ## read classification --numsoftclipstobeconsideredmessy $rco.numsoftclipstobeconsideredmessy --nummismatchestobeconsideredmessy $rco.nummismatchestobeconsideredmessy
## postprocessing && test -d 'results/GeminiChromosomeLogs' && zip -r -q -j 'results/chromosomelogs.zip' 'results/GeminiChromosomeLogs' || echo 'No log files.'

param.label: Keep both-side softclips?
param.help: Trust that both-side softclips are probe and should stay softclipped?

param.label: Trust softclips?
param.help: If true, having softclips doesn't automatically trigger indel realignment. Also, won't try to stitch the softclips.

param.label: Keep probe?
param.help: Trust that probe-side softclips are probe and should stay softclipped?

param.label: Remask messy softclips?
param.help: If true, read-ends that were originally softclipped and are still highly mismatching to reference after realignment are re-softclipped, even if not configured to keep probe softclips. If false, only N-softclips are remasked when not keeping probe softclips.

param.label: Set chromosomes to process
param.help: Comma-separated list of chromosome names.

expand.help: Read pairs with map quality less than this value should be filtered. If only one mate in a pair has a low map quality, it is treated as split (or derivations thereof). Should not be negative.

param.label: Filter reads marked as not proper pairs?
Treat non-F1R2/F2R1 read pairs as improper?
param.help: Even if flagged as properly paired?

param.label: Set minimum preferred support
param.help: Instances of a found variant before it can be considered to realign around.

param.label: Set minimum preferred anchor
param.help: Around indel to count an observation toward good evidence.

param.label: Set minimum required indel support
param.help: Don't even allow otherwise strong indels that we attempt to rescue in if they have num observations below this.

param.label: Set minimum required anchor
param.help: Don't even allow otherwise strong indels that we attempt to rescue in if they have min anchor below this.

param.label: Set maximum mess threshold
param.help: Don't allow indels with average mess above this value.

param.label: Set bin size
param.help: Within which to consider indels overlapping and eligible for pruning.

param.label: Require positive outcome for snowball?
param.help: Whether to filter out indels that did not have any realignment attempts at all during snowballing (stricter than base level of filtering indels that had failed realignment attempts).

param.label: Set directional mess threshold
param.help: Proportion of directionally messy (ForwardMessy or ReverseMessy, etc) reads in neighborhood above which we should silence the affected mates.

param.label: Set messy map quality
param.help: Mapping quality of reads below which, when combined with high mismatch/softclips, a read is considered a suspicious/multi-mapping messy read.

param.label: Silence suspicious MD reads?
param.help: Whether to silence read pairs whose MD tags indicate suspicion.

param.label: Silence directional mess reads?
param.help: Whether to silence read mates which are very messy and have clean mates, given that the proportion of such reads in the neighborhood exceeds DirectionalMessThreshold.

param.label: Silence messy map mess reads?
param.help: Whether to silence read pairs that are messy and have one or both mates with mapping quality below MessyMapq, given that the proportion of such reads in the neighborhood exceeds DirectionalMessThreshold.

param.label: Set number of softclips to be considered messy
param.help: When classifying reads (e.g. imperfect, messy, directional messy), the mininum number of softclips that will trigger one of the messy classifications, given that softclips are not to be trusted.

param.label: Set number of mismatches to be considered messy
param.help: When classifying reads (e.g. imperfect, messy, directional messy), the minimum number of mismatches that will trigger one of the messy classifications.

data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Sorted, stitched, indel realigned BAM

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
@WID@
Pisces GeminiMulti takes in a messy BAM, and returns an error-corrected variant-calling-ready BAM, simultaneously doing the jobs of read-stitching and indel realigning. When reads are trivially stitchable (compatible cigar string), it stitches. When reads disagree, it attempts indel realignment with the help of the mate.
**Input**
- Sample (BAM), that is assumed to be sorted, i.e. alignment reads should be sorted by mapped reference position. This assumption allows Gemini to process BAMs in one pass without a large memory footprint. Most standard aligners produce sorted BAM files. Positions in BAM files are expected to use 0-based coordinate system. - Reference genome (FASTA) - File with string tags to keep from R1 (TXT)
**Output**
@HELP_AO@ - Chromosome logs (ZIP), containing all files of the GeminiChromosomeLogs folder @HELP_GS@ @HELP_L@ - Sorted, stitched, indel realigned result file (BAM)
.. class:: infomark
**References**
@REFERENCES@
